meta.description: Common SMARTS-based tautomer transforms (keto-enol, imine-enamine, amide-imidol, nitro-aci-nitro, etc.). Each rule has: id, name, smarts_match, smarts_replace, priority, notes.

rules.name: keto <-> enol
rules.description: Convert simple carbonyl (keto) to enol form. Matching is coarse; application must verify H availability on alpha carbon.
rules.notes: This rule requires additional code to identify alpha carbon and move H; SMARTS replace is illustrative and not a direct bake-in replacement string. Use matcher to find pattern and then programmatically move H from alpha carbon to oxygen.

rules.name: imine <-> enamine
rules.description: Flip N=C to C=C-N (imine <-> enamine). Programmatic transform required to move H/adjust bond orders.
rules.notes: Handle stereochemistry and check atom valences.

rules.name: amide <-> imidol (amide tautomer)
rules.description: Amide to imidol (rare). Requires proton transfer from N to O and bond order changes.

rules.name: enamine/imine aromatic stabilization
rules.description: Placeholder for aromatic-specific tautomer adjustments; may be handled via scoring rather than explicit transform.
rules.notes: No direct SMARTS replacement; scoring step prefers aromaticity-preserving tautomers.

rules.name: phenol <-> quinone-like
rules.description: Phenol/quinone resonance; handled conservatively via scoring.
